answerText: Randolph Henry Ash[10] Ash is the focus of Roland Mitchell's studies in this A. S. Byatt novel, in which Mitchell and Maud Bailey search for correspondences between Ash and LaMotte.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Dartmouth A + DCC + VCU A | 4 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This author described "the tricksy hero Herakles" in "The Garden of Proserpina" and the most notable critical study of him is Mortimer Cropper's The Great Ventriloquist. For 10 points each: [10] Name this Victorian poet, the lover of Christabel LaMotte. He was inspired by Norse myth to write the epic "Ragnar√∂k" and the erotic "Ask to Embla."
